item.description:
On a stiflingly hot August morning in 1892, the parents of Lizzie Borden were found brutally axe-murdered in their home in Fall River, Mass. Lizzie Borden was the prime suspect. This led to a sensational murder trial, in which Lizzie was acquitted. But many people still believed she was guilty. This remains one of the most notorious -- and unsolved -- murders in history.

Lizzie Borden Live is a one-woman show about the real Lizzie Borden. The play is currently touring around the country, and will be in Providence for two nights at the historic Columbus Theatre. The show has already won several awards and looks amazing!

The Columbus Theatre is also pretty cool to see. It seems to have as colorful a past as Lizzie -- it is one of those beautiful old movie theatres that at one point degenerated into porn. It is now a venue for the esteemed Rhode Island Film Festival, and gets some pretty good films and shows.

Please order your own ticket online -- this theatre is open seating, so we can sit together. And it has over 1,000 seats, so I don't think we'll have a problem. Also, it's fairly easy to get street parking on Broadway. The show starts at 8 p.m. -- let's meet at 7:30 to sit together.

After the show, if you're interested, we can go for drinks and apps at Julian's, a few doors down.
item.how_to_find_us: Meet in theatre lobby at 7:30 pm -- I will email my cell after you RSVP
